body_content.explanation: the part of the body at the bottom of the leg on which a person or animal stands:
examples: I've got a blister on my left foot.
I've been on my feet (= standing) all day and I'm exhausted.
You look tired. Why don't you put your feet up (= sit or lie down with your feet resting on something)?
Please wipe your feet (= clean the bottom of your shoes) before you come into the house.

body_content.explanation: to stand up after you have been sitting:
examples: He rose to his feet when she walked in.
Are you going by bicycle or on foot?

body_content.explanation: a unit of measurement, equal to twelve inches or 0.3048 metres, sometimes shown by the symbol ′:
examples: The man was standing only a few feet away.
She is five feet/foot three inches tall.

body_content.explanation: the bottom or lower end of a space or object:
examples: They built a house at the foot of a cliff.
She dreamed she saw someone standing at the foot of her bed.
There's a note explaining the quotation at the foot of the page.

body_content.explanation: a unit of division of a line of poetry containing one strong beat and one or two weaker ones
to pay an amount of money:
examples: His parents footed the bill for his college tuition.
They refused to foot the cost of the wedding.
The company will foot her expenses.
